result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond P Reichert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IF REVOKED: 36 days credit. Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
$300.00 BAIL APPLIED. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain HSED/GED.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Courtney R.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Cases 15CM2408 and 15CM1603 were both dismissed and read into 15CM1432.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - STAYED.
Day Report Center: 60 days, consecutive to huber sentence. Good time not allowed on DRC. If defendant successfully completes DRC, the 30 days of huber will be permanently stayed.
NOTE: DRC is provisional if DRC will accept Defendant due to being Milwaukee Co. resident. Defendant to report to DRC immediately upon release. If NOT accepted into DRC, no condition time imposed.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 189 days were granted.
Unpaid costs previously imposed are to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 04/01/2020 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail

04:08 PM Defendant Raymond P Reichert in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Brook Erickson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with counsel that they have received and reviewed the Revocation Order and Warrant.  Court reviews the recommendations from the Department on the record.  State presents their recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Martinez presents his recommendations for sentencing.  Ms. Berenson appears and presents statements.  Peter Reichert appears and presents statements.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Martinez presents additional statements.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

8 MONTHS JAIL Straight Time (189 Days Credit) - sentence to commence forthwith.

Any remaining Court Costs/Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00/month effective April 1, 2020; alternate for non-payment is to convert to a civil judgment.
Appointing attorney Nicholas Martinez
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: April 8, 2016 Hearing.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 19, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 19, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (Fax) Dated 04/14/16, from DRC, regarding the Defendant's sentence.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Raymond P Reichert in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Courtney R. make statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR  (36 DAYS CREDIT, IF REVOKED) -  Transfer alllowed to Milwaukee County

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs /drug paraphernalia
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain HSED/GED
____No violent contact with: Courtney R. 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME: HUBER:  30 days, 30 DAYS STAYED.   

DAY REPORT CENTER:  60 DAYS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 30 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 

NOTE:  DRC is provisional if DRC will accept Defendant due to being a Milwuakee County resident.  Defendant to report to DRC immediately upon release.   IF NOT accepted into DRC, no condition time imposed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with business listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Raymond P Reichert in court, in custody, with attorney Jess Martinez.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sam Benedict appears as friend of the court and states defendant is represented by Atty. Martinez.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Bail can be addressed at next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
